definitions: Past tense of tear: to pull or rip (something) apart or to pieces with force.
Past tense of tear: to make a hole or split in (something) by pulling it apart.
Past tense of tear: to move very quickly in a reckless or uncontrolled way.
examples: He tore the letter into tiny pieces.
The nail tore a hole in her dress.
The car tore down the street.
